thing-type.label: MSP-3-1-X1 Z-Wave Plus Micro Smart Plug ON/OFF
thing-type.description: Z-Wave Plus Micro Smart Plug ON/OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe NodOn Micro Smart Plug can be controlled by any kind of Z-Wave® (or Z-Wave Plus®) gateway or other Z-Wave® controller (standalone mode) such as the NodOn® Soft Remote or Octan Remote. <br /&gtIt existed in both standard, Type E (French) or Schuko (German). Its very small design and volume allow easy integration, without obstructing nearby power holes on a power strip. Furthermore, it can perform Power and Energy Metering. <br /&gtThe NodOn Smart Plug is based on brand new 500 series Z-Wave® module from Sigma Designs®, and support all the new features of Z-Wave Plus® standard: <br /&gtLonger range (up to 40m), lower power consumption, higher data rate transmission, and many more new features.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo include/add to the Z-Wave network, long press during 2 seconds to send several NIF during 30 seconds or a triple press to send a single NIF </p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo exclude/remove from the Z-Wave network, long press during 2 seconds to send several NIF during 30 seconds or a triple press to send a single NIF </p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Default State
parameter.description: Status after a power outage or after being plugged<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the status of the Micro Smart Plug after a power outage or after being plugged</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Follow State
parameter.description: Allows to enable or disable Group 2 &amp; Group 3<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to enable or disable Group 2 &amp; Group 3</p&gt <p&gtThe value may be the sum of available values. For example, if you want to enable Group 2 &amp; 3, the parameter value is 1+2=3</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Always On
parameter.description: Forces the Micro Smart Plug status to be ON<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter forces the Micro Smart Plug status to be ON. While enable it is not possible to switch OFF the plug (local or wireless).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Power Auto-Sending Report
parameter.description: Power report for changes of x % W<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter will send a power report automatically if the power value changes of x % W (Watt) compared to the last report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_2
parameter.label: 22: Overload Report
parameter.description: Switch off Micro Smart Plug in case the power is above x W<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter will switch off the Micro Smart Plug in case the power is above x W (Watt) and send an alarm to the primary controller. This parameter has the highest execution priority between all the metering configurations for security reason.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Overload Report enable with a upper limit of 50 W
Overload Report enable with a upper limit of 100 W
Overload Report enable with a upper limit of 150 W
Overload Report enable with a upper limit of 200 W
Overload Report enable with a upper limit of 250 W
Overload Report enable with a upper limit of 500 W

parameter.name: config_23_2
parameter.label: 23: Energy Auto-Sending Report
parameter.description: Auto energy report if value changes of x Wh<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter will send a new energy report automatically if the energy value changes of x Wh (Watt-hour) compared to the last report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_2
parameter.label: 24: Metering Heartbeat
parameter.description: Reporting intervall for power and energy to lifeline.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhatever other metering reports, this parameter will send one power and one energy report to the lifeline every x s (Seconds).</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Metering Pulse enable and send report every hour
Enable and send report every 6 hours
Enable and send report every 12 hours

parameter.name: config_25_2
parameter.label: 25: Power High Threshold
parameter.description: Defines the High Threshold value in W.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the High Threshold power value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_26_2
parameter.label: 26: Power Low Threshold
parameter.description: Defines the Low Threshold value in W.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the Low Threshold power value.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_27_1
parameter.label: 27: Power Threshold Action
parameter.description: Defines actions if the power Low/High Threshold are reached.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter will define the Micro Smart Plug actions if the power Low and High Threshold are reached.</p&gt <p&gtThe value may be the sum of available values. For example, if you want:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtPower High Threshold Action is enable and sent ON to Group 4 (3)</li&gt <li&gtPower Low Threshold Action is enable and sent OFF to Group 5 (4)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtthe parameter value must be 3+4=7.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Power High Group 4 OFF & Power Low Group 5 OFF
Power High Group 4 ON & Power Low Group 5 OFF
Power High Group 4 OFF & Power Low Gourp 5 ON
Power High Group 4 ON & Power Low Group 5 ON

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifetime
parameter.description: Report Information to Main Controller.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThis group is generally used to report information of the Micro Smart Plug to the Main Controller of the network.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Follow State
parameter.description: Send status if local button is used to associated devices.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtWhen the Micro Smart Plug is switched ON (respectively OFF) using the local button, it will send ON (respectively OFF) command to the associated devices. No command is sent if the Micro Smart Plug is switched ON or OFF wirelessly.</p&gt <p&gtThis group is configurable through the parameter 3.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Follow Comp State
parameter.description: Send status if local button is used to associated devices.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtWhen the Micro Smart Plug is switched ON (respectively OFF) using the local button, it will send OFF (respectively ON) command to the associated devices. No command is sent if the Micro Smart Plug is switched ON or OFF wirelessly.</p&gt <p&gtThis group is configurable through the parameter 3.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Metering High Threshold
parameter.description: Send ON/OFF command to associated devices if threshold reached<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtWhen the Micro Smart Plug reaches over the high threshold of power defined by the configuration parameter, it will send OFF or ON command to the associated devices.</p&gt <p&gtThis group is configurable through the parameter 25 and 27.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Metering Low Threshold
parameter.description: Send ON/OFF command to associated devices if threshold reached<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtWhen the Micro Smart Plug reaches below the low threshold of power defined by the configuration parameter, it will send OFF or ON command to the associated devices.</p&gt <p&gtThis group is configurable through the parameters 26 and 27.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_6
parameter.label: 6: Metering - Report
parameter.description: Report metering to devices in this group.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtAll the meter reports and notifications triggered by Metering parameters will be reported to the devices present in this group.</p&gt <p&gtThis group is configurable through the parameters 21, 22, 23 and 24.</p&gt
